questions.stem: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of alkanes?
questions.explanation: Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons with only single bonds. Double bonds are found in alkenes.

questions.stem: What type of hybridization is found in ethene (C2H4)?
questions.explanation: Ethene has a C=C double bond, requiring sp2 hybridization with trigonal planar geometry.

questions.stem: In which part of the chloroplast does the Calvin cycle occur?
questions.explanation: The Calvin cycle (light-independent reactions) occurs in the stroma, the fluid-filled space surrounding the thylakoids.

questions.stem: What is the primary function of NADPH in photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: NADPH provides the reducing power (electrons) needed to convert CO2 into glucose during the Calvin cycle.
